meanings.definition: A line serving as a basis for measurement or comparison.
meanings.sent1: The scientist drew baselines on the graph to compare the data.
meanings.sent2: Before making any changes, it's important to establish baselines for comparison.
meanings.sent3: The artist mistakenly used the baselines as a guide for drawing a straight line.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, the baselines are like the foundation of a building, providing stability.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful markers to highlight the baselines on the chart.

meanings.definition: The starting point or reference point for a process or activity.
meanings.sent1: The baselines for the project were set during the initial planning stage.
meanings.sent2: As we reach the end of the year, we can look back at the baselines we established.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his morning coffee was the baselines for his energy levels.
meanings.sent4: For the team, the baselines were like a compass, guiding them in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The baselines in this experiment will help us track our progress over time.
